content: panel repeat front panel assembly and seaming the panels together place the two parts on top of each other it doesn t really matter which sides are they facing just make sure to line up your row especially if you have used different colors using the yarn needle seam the parts together i like to use the mattress stitch measure 38/39/39/40 cm in the middle of upper part for your neck hole seam the shouldes together leaving the hole for a neck try the top on before weaving the ends in see how big you like the neck hole if you like your top to be more off the shoulders or a less and adjust it to your liking on both sides see a photo 3 the dashed lines show where to seam the panels together photo 3 weave in the ends and that s it method 2 using this method we will be working in rounds make 102/112/122/132 chain s slip_stitch at the first chain be careful not to twist round 1 4ch treble_crochet into each of your chain join with a slip_stitch at the 4th chain of the first ch4 round 2 2ch half_double_crochet into each treble_crochet join with a slip_stitch at the 2nd chain of the first 2ch round 3 if you are making a stripy top change colour now 4ch treble_crochet into each half_double_crochet join with a slip_stitch at the 4th chain of the first 4ch repeat rounds 2 & 3 3/3/4/5 more times if you would like to make this top longer then what has been shown in the measurements repeat rounds 2 & 3 one or more times one 2 & 3 rounds repeat will give you extra 4 cm you can make it as long as you want just bear in mind you will need more yarn than what i have written in the basic information at the beginning round 10/10/12/14 we are going to add chain s for the sleeves in this round make 10/12/15/15 chs these chs are the foundation for your sleeve bind off cut off yarn lay your work flat with your added chs on your right side go on the other side of your work you are going to mke extra chain s now as a base for your second sleeve choose the last treble_crochet which you can see and make a slip_stitch into it if you want to be sure you can count half the amount of your treble_crochet stitches of the previous round and put your slip_stitch into that stitch but i do it without counting this pattern is really forgiving - make 12/14/17/17 chs this will be the second sleeve see a photo 4 it shows the chains and numbers of chains according to sizes photo 4 turn your work make a half_double_crochet into 3rd chain from your hook make half_double_crochet into each chain and continue making half_double_crochet into each treble_crochet of your previous round until you reach the chain s make half_double_crochet into each
